recipes.name: Roasted Vegetable Quinoa Bowl
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. 2. In a medium saucepan, bring the quinoa and vegetable broth to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is absorbed. 3. While the quinoa is cooking, spread the zucchini, yellow squash, and red bell pepper on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika, salt, and pepper. Roast for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned. 4. To assemble the bowls, divide the quinoa between four bowls. Top each bowl with roasted vegetables, avocado, parsley, and feta cheese. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Mushroom Risotto
recipes.cooking_method: 1. In a large saucepan, heat the vegetable broth over medium heat. 2. In another large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and are tender, about 10 minutes. 3. Add the arborio rice and stir to coat with the oil. Add the white wine and stir until absorbed. 4. Add 1 cup of the warm broth to the rice and stir until absorbed. Repeat with the remaining broth, 1 cup at a time, stirring until the broth is absorbed before adding more. 5. When the rice is tender and creamy, stir in the parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. 6. Serve the risotto garnished with parsley.

recipes.name: Eggplant Parmesan
recipes.cooking_method: Slice eggplants and dip in beaten eggs, then coat in breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Bake at 375F for 30 minutes. Layer tomato sauce, eggplant slices, and mozzarella cheese in a baking dish, and bake for another 20 minutes. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.cooking_method: 1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, bell peppers, zucchini, eggplant, and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. 2. Add the diced tomatoes, basil, thyme, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are very tender and the flavors have melded together. 3. Serve hot or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
recipes.cooking_method: 1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and cook until crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside. 2. Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Add them to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 8-10 minutes. Remove and set aside. 3. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and flour and cook for another 2 minutes. 4. Add the red wine and chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken thighs and bacon back to the pot. Cover and simmer for 45-60 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. 5. Serve hot, garnished with parsley.

recipes.name: Vegan Chickpea Curry
recipes.cooking_method: 1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. 2. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 3. Add the chickpeas, diced tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, turmeric, and cumin. 4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the curry has thickened. 5. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 6. Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Vegan Lentil Soup
recipes.cooking_method: 1. In a large pot, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat. 2. Add the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 3. Add the lentils, vegetable broth, tomato paste, bay leaf, cumin, coriander, and paprika. 4. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender. 5. Remove the bay leaf, and season with salt and pepper to taste. 6. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. 
2. Add the vegetable oil and swirl to coat the pan. 
3. Add the garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 
4. Add the vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. 
5. Add the soy sauce and hoisin sauce, and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes. 
6. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Roasted Vegetables with Quinoa
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F. 
2. In a large bowl, combine the eggplant, bell peppers, onion, zucchini, garlic, olive oil, thyme, salt, and black pepper. 
3. Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 
4. While the vegetables are roasting, rinse the quinoa and add it to a medium saucepan with the vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. 
5. Serve the roasted vegetables over the quinoa and top with chopped parsley.
